docs.lead_paragraph: Congress is taking steps to allow imports of prescription drugs from Canada, in the hope of giving American consumers access to lower-priced medicines. The Food and Drug Administration and drug companies oppose the legislation, but many lawmakers said they know of no serious safety hazards with Canadian imports.

headline.main: For Price Break on Drugs, Congress Looks to Canada

docs.abstract: Congress moves to allow imports of lower-priced prescription drugs from Canada; FDA and drug companies are opposed but lawmakers like Byron L Dorgan say it would hard to make credible case that there is any risk to consumers (M)
